definition: to roll (up)/to sweep up/to carry on/roll

sentences.english: Publishers in Paris and New York had secretly received the manuscript on microfilm.
sentences.chinese: 巴黎和紐約的出版商祕密接收了收稿的影印膠捲。

sentences.english: With this instant film the picture develops in only one minute.
sentences.chinese: 用這種快速膠捲，照片僅用一分鐘就會顯影。

sentences.english: I want to have two rolls of film developed and some prints made.
sentences.chinese: 我想沖洗兩筒膠捲，還要洗印一些照片。

sentences.english: It needs to be loaded into the camera in a black bag or dark room.
sentences.chinese: 裝這種膠捲的時候需要在一個暗袋裏或者暗室裏進行。

sentences.english: I still have 4 exposures left on this film.
sentences.chinese: 我這膠捲上還存下四張未拍。

sentences.english: But film is relatively limited in its range, as are digital cameras.
sentences.chinese: 但是膠捲被它自身的範圍所限制，數碼相機也一樣。

sentences.english: Can I get a xerox of some material on microfilm?
sentences.chinese: 我可以複印縮微膠捲上的一些資料嗎？

sentences.english: Slow-burning; used instead of celluloid for motion-picture film.
sentences.chinese: 燃燒慢，代替賽璐珞用於電影膠捲中。

sentences.english: I keep thinking that bag of film.
We're almost out of film and each take is so long.
sentences.chinese: 膠捲快用完了，每個鏡頭都超長。

sentences.english: Although they often resemble traditional cameras, they don't use film.
sentences.chinese: 雖然外觀和傳統的相機相似，但數碼相機不用膠捲。

sentences.english: This scene you see being filmed has been processed in Technicolor.
sentences.chinese: 這，你所看到的拍攝場景已經記錄到了電影膠捲上。

sentences.english: Do you want a colour film for slides or prints?
sentences.chinese: 你要的彩色膠捲是做幻燈片用還是爲了衝曬加印？

sentences.english: I sent three rolls of film away to be processed.
sentences.chinese: 我送了三個膠捲去沖印。

sentences.english: The oil was stored in a film cannister.
sentences.chinese: 把精油儲存在膠捲盒裏。

definition: film/roll of film/also written 膠捲|胶卷
Kodak (brand, US film company)/full name Eastman Kodak Company 伊士曼柯達公司|伊士曼柯达公司[Yi1 shi4 man4 Ke1 da2 Gong1 si1]
body of a vehicle or machine/fuselage of a plane
(technical) manual/(book of) directions/synopsis (of a play or film)/specification (patent)/CL:本[ben3]
to be overdue/to exceed the time limit/to expire (as in expiration date)
